intro: Waltheria astropus, commonly known as the starleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers and heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive star-like pattern. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other vines and flowering plants. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its rapid growth and ornamental value make it a popular choice for gardeners seeking a vibrant, climbing plant.
